[18-Oct-18 03:16 AM] Deleted User#0000 (pinned)
```From my testing on DICEv1 anyone looking to improve it needs to start with the following:
1) Show if the contract has entropy TX in diceinfo 
2) Have a table end parameter on table creation, where the dice contract expires and the funds can be withdrawn by the creator
3) Figure some solution to scale, a single table can only take so many parallell bets before it just stops working. 
4) Make a GUI to make it easier for people to play
5) Some early ideas for 51% attack problem:
The 51% problem is low chance with close enough dPoW freq... we were gong to try and notarise the chain every 2 blocks as a hacky way to solve it, this could also be solved, by having a single miner, like I have done with STREAMER chain, and have all coins mined out of the faucet.
Or if you want to bet with real money, use a sister chain, where coins are mined bought and MoMoM migrate them to the DICE chain to play dice.```

We can see how to pass the error back so all CC can print error on RPC command.

[19-Oct-18 10:05 AM] CrisF#3405
```Set the timeout block longer. If the dice creator node is offline, after the timeout block the sytem will automatically declare the bets winner and payout winning funds. Long timeout block will ensure house to not loose any funds if there is any downtime of the node and comes back online within the time.```

[19-Oct-18 11:02 AM] jl777c#5810
@ComputerGenie the way the dice is provably random is that neither side knows both entropy values when they are betting


[19-Oct-18 11:02 AM] jl777c#5810
the dealer generates the entropy tx (no idea why the chainmakers dont make more entropy tx with 0.0001 values)


[19-Oct-18 11:02 AM] jl777c#5810
but it is only visible as the hash(entropy) the hentropy


[19-Oct-18 11:03 AM] jl777c#5810
the bettor then picks a random dealer hentropy utxo adds his entropy in the clear


[19-Oct-18 11:03 AM] jl777c#5810
now the dealer can tell if it is a win or loss, if he is honest he pays out the wins immediately


[19-Oct-18 11:04 AM] jl777c#5810
if he doesnt and it times out, it must be a loss of dealer, ie automatic win, otherwise the dealer can just never payout wins


[19-Oct-18 11:04 AM] Deleted User#0000
If my node was betting with a pubkey that did not have the WIF in the wallet (daemon started with wrong one ) would that cause an issue with dicefinish?


[19-Oct-18 11:04 AM] jl777c#5810
so, given this, what is the attack vector by allowing users to create entropy tx?


[19-Oct-18 11:04 AM] jl777c#5810
your node wont be able to dicefinish properly, but the dealer node doesnt need any privkeys from the bettors


[19-Oct-18 11:05 AM] Deleted User#0000

[19-Oct-18 11:05 AM] Deleted User#0000

[19-Oct-18 11:59 AM] Deleted User#0000
@0x03 
```#!/bin/bash
addr=RU3yYGAz1xVjkLbeEdxKq5WpQNDdkYd83V
./listassetchains | while read coin; do
  clean=0
  echo "[$coin] Cleaning Wallet"
  while [[ $clean = 0 ]]; do
    result=$(komodo-cli -ac_name=$coin z_mergetoaddress '["ANY_TADDR"]' $addr 0.0001 0 0 2> /dev/null)
    outcome=$(echo $?)
    if [[ $outcome = 6 ]]; then
      clean=1
    elif [[ $outcome = 0 ]]; then
      remain=$(echo $result | jq -r .remainingUTXOs)
      echo "[$coin] $remain utxo remaining"
      if [[ $remain < 10 ]]; then
        clean=1
      fi
    else
      echo "[$coin] ABORTING - Some error happened!"
      clean=1
    fi
  done
  echo "[$coin] Wallet Clean!"
done
```

[20-Oct-18 06:25 AM] jl777c#5810

[20-Oct-18 09:28 PM] Deleted User#0000
`server stratum+tcp://103.6.12.112 --port 3067 --user <address>` normal port
`server stratum+tcp://103.6.12.112 --port 3069 --user <address>` Nh port

[22-Oct-18 03:30 AM] Llama#1330
How do I access the cli on windows?


[22-Oct-18 03:34 AM] SHossain#0007
@Llama get the komodo binaries for windows from here and run them through command prompt https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/releases/download/multios-201810011016-71fc062/komodo_win64_master.zip


[22-Oct-18 03:35 AM] SHossain#0007
to start dice in Windows, you need to type 
```
komodod.exe -ac_name=KMDICE -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=144.76.217.232
```

[22-Oct-18 07:25 AM] siu#3920
it doesnt seem to be doing the confirmations on time though üò¶


[22-Oct-18 07:27 AM] ComputerGenie#7004
`loopvar="0"
echo "Waiting on confirm of tx"
while [ $txval -le $loopvar ] 
do
txval=$(komodo-cli ac_name=KMDICE gettransaction $tx | jq '.confirmations')
sleep 1
done`
Will work nicely to catch the tx conf


[22-Oct-18 07:27 AM] siu#3920
nice... let me see


[22-Oct-18 07:27 AM] ComputerGenie#7004

[22-Oct-18 07:37 AM] Decker#3767
btw, may be this will useful, to print hex block simply edit `pool.js` with this:
```    function SubmitBlock(blockHex, callback) {

        var rpcCommand, rpcArgs;
        if (options.hasSubmitMethod) {
            rpcCommand = 'submitblock';
            rpcArgs = [blockHex];
        } else {
            rpcCommand = 'getblocktemplate';
            rpcArgs = [{
                'mode': 'submit',
                'data': blockHex
            }];
        }

        emitLog('Block hex : ' + blockHex);  // add this line

        _this.daemon.cmd(rpcCommand,
            rpcArgs,
            function(results) {
                for (var i = 0; i < results.length; i++) {
```

[22-Oct-18 10:11 AM] ComputerGenie#7004
DeckerToday at 9:37 AM
btw, may be this will useful, to print hex block simply edit pool.js with this:

   ` function SubmitBlock(blockHex, callback) {
        var rpcCommand, rpcArgs;
        if (options.hasSubmitMethod) {
            rpcCommand = 'submitblock';
            rpcArgs = [blockHex];
        } else {
            rpcCommand = 'getblocktemplate';
            rpcArgs = [{
                'mode': 'submit',
                'data': blockHex
            }];
        }
        emitLog('Block hex : ' + blockHex);  // add this line
        _this.daemon.cmd(rpcCommand,
            rpcArgs,
            function(results) {
                for (var i = 0; i < results.length; i++) {`

[22-Oct-18 10:39 AM] Decker#3767
i'm modified a pool to include in block only 5 txes (4 txes + 1 coinbase) from mempool, to get short hex block to analyse. example of produced block:
https://gist.github.com/DeckerSU/aa80df1719c0eac0ee5d5e9fc256a1ea
pool software counts that daemon accept this block, but in real - this block don't appears on network. when i tried to submit this block manually again - daemon returns "duplicate-invalid" ... that means that block already known to daemon and it's invalid.

seems, if we understand why daemon count this block as invalid - problem will be solved.

[22-Oct-18 11:16 AM] Decker#3767
@jl777c seems all nomp based software affected ... if mempool have more than 0x7F (127) txes - every mined block will fail, bcz seems it have incorrect `varint` encoding. when chain is stalled earlier - we have more than 170 txes in mempool. but to be sure at 100% - i'll need to write some additional code and try to reproduce it.

[22-Oct-18 11:22 AM] Decker#3767
```        if (this.txCount <= 0x7f){
            var varInt = new Buffer(txCount, 'hex');
        }
        else if (this.txCount <= 0x7fff){
            var varInt = new Buffer.concat([Buffer('FD', 'hex'), new Buffer(txCount, 'hex')]);
        }
```

This part seems problem.

[22-Oct-18 12:02 PM] Decker#3767
Fix for all nomp-based software:
```if (this.txCount <= 0x7f){
    var varInt = new Buffer(txCount, 'hex');
}
else if (this.txCount <= 0x7fff){
    if (txCount.length == 2) txCount = "00" + txCount;
    var varInt = new Buffer.concat([Buffer('FD', 'hex'), util.reverseBuffer(new Buffer(txCount, 'hex'))]);
}
```
I save the logic of 0x7f and 0x7fff ... don't know why devs use "signed" checking here (may be compare with 0x80 in nodeJS cause problems), so, examples:

```this.txCount = 15, varInt = 0f
this.txCount = 127, varInt = 7f
this.txCount = 128, varInt = fd8000
this.txCount = 256, varInt = fd0001
this.txCount = 777, varInt = fd0903```

[23-Oct-18 04:38 PM] Llama#1330
how split up utxo


[23-Oct-18 04:40 PM] c2k#4915
in barterdex click exchange on the coin you want to manage your utxo's


[23-Oct-18 04:41 PM] c2k#4915
then in the par on the top left click "inventory"


[23-Oct-18 04:41 PM] c2k#4915
you should see your utxo's on the lower half of the screen


[23-Oct-18 04:41 PM] c2k#4915
if you ahve 1 utxo then you want to select "make inventory" in the center which will split your balance into the lots shown


[23-Oct-18 04:42 PM] Llama#1330
i have more than 100 utxo


[23-Oct-18 04:43 PM] Llama#1330
@c2k


[23-Oct-18 04:45 PM] c2k#4915
im not an expert on utxo's but i think you want your utxo sizes to fairly match the utxo sizes of the other side of the trade


[23-Oct-18 04:45 PM] c2k#4915
so if your selling you want your utxo sizes to be similar sizes to the buyers in bdex


[23-Oct-18 04:45 PM] c2k#4915
if you send the balance to yourself you will get 1 utxo of your size


[23-Oct-18 04:45 PM] c2k#4915
then you can re-split

[24-Oct-18 12:43 AM] Flexatron#8809
Anyone does the bet 1 lose bet 2 lose bet 4 lose bet 8 until he wins his losses back and then starts at 1 again?:trollface: :abusedsmily:


[24-Oct-18 12:47 AM] Flexatron#8809
anyone risks high numbers to win high?


[24-Oct-18 12:55 AM] Flexatron#8809
Who else closes the GUI after winning "too many times" to "reset" the odds ??:trollface:


[24-Oct-18 01:03 AM] Flexatron#8809
The first dice winning strategy is the *Martingale*, which is easy to understand and learn, as this is one of the most popular strategies for dice. The first thing you need to do is to bet a single unit and stick with it until you lose. And when you lose, double your wager. Once you get a win, you go back to your original wager. Doing this heightens your chance of getting your losses back.

One more dice winning strategy that is similar to Martingale is the *D‚ÄôAlembert*. The only difference is that you only increase your bet amount by x1 when you lose on a roll and decrease it by one when you win.

Another tactic that you can use in your Bitcoin dice game is the *Paroli*. In this strategy, you start with the bet of your choice. When you win on that bet, you can double your next bet until either you lose on the next bet or you are in a winning streak. When either of the two happens, you can rest your bet amount. This is less risky than Martingale and D‚ÄôAlembert, since the aim of this strategy is to take advantage of the lucky streaks.


[24-Oct-18 01:05 AM] Oszy#5734
@Flexatron  I have simulated Martingale and Fibonacci over 10000 turns each multiple times, the chances that you are actually winning a little bit after 10000 turns are very slim


[24-Oct-18 01:07 AM] Oszy#5734
You can try with this one if you want to see numbers: https://www.bettingsimulation.com/
Use the european roulette, always bet red/black

{Embed}
https://www.bettingsimulation.com/
Betting Systems Simulation
Betting systems simulation

Classic Martingale betting system simulation | GSimulator
Complete simulation of the Classic Martingale betting system. GSimulator generates up to 100000 bets and calculates real time results of a Classic Martingale for given odds, bet unit and bankroll using weighted random bets distribution.

[24-Oct-18 03:59 AM] Decker#3767
i'm always use the following steps:
```
rawtx=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicebet $name $fundingtxid $amount $odds | jq -r .hex)
txid=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE sendrawtransaction $rawtx)
sleep 5
./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicestatus $name $fundingtxid $txid```

and some times it runs perfect, and sometimes produce `CCduration no hashBlock for txid <txid>` after sendrawtransaction.


[24-Oct-18 04:00 AM] Decker#3767
no other changes, always same steps ... but sometimes it's ok, and sometimes after sendrawtx i get "no hashBlock for txid".


[24-Oct-18 04:01 AM] Decker#3767
except this thing, all other - seems stable.

[24-Oct-18 05:58 PM] Llama#1330

[24-Oct-18 05:59 PM] Decker#3767
New version of Windows KMDICE remote GUI available. Small interface improvements.
https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/1a982d48b6a57d0af5cb5fce71e4c36b6b319847e72a5fc4a4f8f1a0e5d18aca/detection

{Attachments}
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/502423250421153802/504821270760783872/kmdice-gui-win.7z


[24-Oct-18 05:59 PM] Llama#1330
is that a wallet?


[24-Oct-18 06:00 PM] Decker#3767

{Attachments}
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/502423250421153802/504821424381493270/unknown.png


[24-Oct-18 06:00 PM] Decker#3767
No, it's GUI for daemon.


[24-Oct-18 06:01 PM] Llama#1330
@yh you need to download https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/releases/download/multios-201810011016-71fc062/komodo_win64_master.zip if you are on windows.


[24-Oct-18 06:01 PM] yh#8735
@Llama ok tq


[24-Oct-18 06:02 PM] Llama#1330
then you open a command prompt and navigate to the folder with cd/(filepath). the last part should be win64.


[24-Oct-18 06:02 PM] Llama#1330
and then paste this in ```komodod.exe -ac_name=KMDICE -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=144.76.217.232```


[24-Oct-18 06:02 PM] Llama#1330
and when that is completely done, open another command prompt and type this in:


[24-Oct-18 06:03 PM] Llama#1330
`komodo-cli.exe -ac_name=KMDICE importprivkey UXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX` replace `UXXX `with your privkey


[24-Oct-18 06:03 PM] Llama#1330
and it should return your KMD address.


[24-Oct-18 06:04 PM] Llama#1330
type this in to the 2nd command prompt to see info about your wallet and such: `komodo-cli.exe -ac_name=KMDICE getinfo`

@Alright :

```
if (this.txCount <= 0x7f){
    var varInt = new Buffer(txCount, 'hex');
}
else if (this.txCount <= 0x7fff){
    if (txCount.length == 2) txCount = "00" + txCount;
    var varInt = new Buffer.concat([Buffer('FD', 'hex'), util.reverseBuffer(new Buffer(txCount, 'hex'))]);
}
        console.log("varINT: "+varInt);
```

 n = 10 it goes down to 0.07%.

[26-Oct-18 04:32 AM] LocoMB#8593
hahaha - ouch:
There are no exceptions that the same color appeared more than 20 times in a row in practice. The record was registered in 1943, when red color came up 32 times in a row! The probability of such event in French Roulette is (18/37)32 = 0.000000000096886885 with the corresponding odds 10,321,314,387:1.

[26-Oct-18 11:30 AM] jl777c#5810
these "fork" issues from what I have heard is that your own node loses sync with the mainchain, but no other node is affected


[26-Oct-18 11:30 AM] jl777c#5810
maybe this is disincentive for the spamming?


[26-Oct-18 11:30 AM] jl777c#5810
I think I know why getblocktemplate is not putting in all the tx from mempool


[26-Oct-18 11:31 AM] jl777c#5810
with many dicebets using mempool utxo, depending on the order you add tx to a block, it might not allow all the mempool tx to be mined. the issue is in miner.cpp where it creates a block. I think fixing that would make things a lot better as it would recycle bets that much better, but still eventually utxo will run out

[27-Oct-18 07:02 AM] HenryChinaski#2919

[27-Oct-18 07:02 AM] HenryChinaski#2919

[27-Oct-18 07:03 AM] HenryChinaski#2919
i mean, i read its in cmd, but how is supposed to the game played? you roll a dice and what else?


[27-Oct-18 07:04 AM] ComputerGenie#7004
it's a simple "hi/low" game
you bet if the house is higher or lower than you based on the odds you pick
House is higher = you loose
House is lower = you win

{Reactions}
üëå 

[27-Oct-18 07:05 AM] HenryChinaski#2919
Ohhhh


[27-Oct-18 07:05 AM] HenryChinaski#2919

[27-Oct-18 07:06 AM] ComputerGenie#7004

[27-Oct-18 07:07 AM] HenryChinaski#2919
Awesome!


[27-Oct-18 07:08 AM] HenryChinaski#2919
oh wait, that means you lost? üòÇ


[27-Oct-18 07:09 AM] Decker#3767
Small explanation of daemon printouts:
```modval 8668 vs 3333 - means that somebody bet with odds=2 and lose (player's number - 8668, house number - 3333)
modval 2293 vs 3333 - same, but win (player's number - 2293, house number - 3333)

odds=2 -> house number=3333
```

{Reactions}
üëÜüèº ü§î 

[27-Oct-18 07:11 AM] Decker#3767
More odds you choose -> lower house number -> harder to win.


[27-Oct-18 07:11 AM] ComputerGenie#7004
*odds=2 -> player number=3333


[27-Oct-18 07:13 AM] Decker#3767
@ComputerGenie may be viceversa ... but meaninng is same: if first number in `modval` is lower that a second number - it's a win.

{Reactions}
üëçüèº (2) üëÜüèº 

[27-Oct-18 07:13 AM] HenryChinaski#2919

[27-Oct-18 12:02 PM] SHossain#0007
@vogelfreund you will find using BarterDEX very hard. Try swapping BEER/PIZZA first using HyperDEX and learn how it works. BarterDEX GUI is for advanced users and devs.


[27-Oct-18 12:07 PM] Decker#3767
@SHossain i don't think that the BarterDEX GUI is for advanced users. We just need understandable description with examples of all functions and basics. Mean, before start BarterDEX every user should understand basic things:
1. what is utxo?
2. what is atomic swap and what the differencies between bdex and cex.
3. steps needed to swap complete.
4. small api description (users should know that alice and bob api exists, and should understand the difference between it)
without these basics - yes, users can find barterdex hard.


[27-Oct-18 12:09 PM] SHossain#0007

[27-Oct-18 05:09 PM] Deleted User#0000
```    if ( (funding= DicePlanFunds(entropyval,entropytxid,sbits,cp,dicepk,fundingtxid,entropytxs)) >= 2*bet*odds+txfee && entropyval != 0 )
    {
        if ( myIsutxo_spentinmempool(entropytxid,0) != 0 )
        {
            CCerror = "entropy txid is spent";
            fprintf(stderr,"%s\n", CCerror.c_str() );
            return("");
        }
        mtx.vin.push_back(CTxIn(entropytxid,0,CScript()));
        if ( AddNormalinputs(mtx,mypk,bet+2*txfee+odds,60) > 0 )
        {
            hentropy = DiceHashEntropy(entropy,mtx.vin[0].prevout.hash);
            mtx.vout.push_back(MakeCC1vout(cp->evalcode,entropyval,dicepk));
            mtx.vout.push_back(MakeCC1vout(cp->evalcode,bet,dicepk));
            mtx.vout.push_back(CTxOut(txfee+odds,CScript() << ParseHex(HexStr(mypk)) << OP_CHECKSIG));
            return(FinalizeCCTx(0,cp,mtx,mypk,txfee,EncodeDiceOpRet('B',sbits,fundingtxid,entropy,zeroid)));
        } else fprintf(stderr,"cant find enough normal inputs for %.8f, plan funding %.8f\n",(double)bet/COIN,(double)funding/COIN);
    }
    if ( entropyval == 0 && funding != 0 )
        CCerror = "cant find dice entropy inputs";
    else
        CCerror = "cant find dice input";
    fprintf(stderr,"%s\n", CCerror.c_str() );
    return("");```

[27-Oct-18 05:46 PM] ComputerGenie#7004
The fork happens when your local node decides that the contract UTXo belongs to your bet and not someone else's; therefore a block containing that UTXO spent by someone else is "invalid" to your node (because your node read the mempool and saw it non in use)

[28-Oct-18 02:17 AM] jl777c#5810
i changed the min entropy needed to 10


[28-Oct-18 02:18 AM] jl777c#5810
2 is too low as 3 simultaneous bettors could end up choosing the same utxo. even though it should be cleanly handled now, the local bet will fail. much better to have the dealer node make sure there are 10+ entropy tx


[28-Oct-18 02:18 AM] Deleted User#0000

[28-Oct-18 02:19 AM] jl777c#5810

[28-Oct-18 02:20 AM] Deleted User#0000
yes, using dicestatus you cna check entropy on blocknotarify (it should be accurate excatly at this time) then create entropy to a threshold


[28-Oct-18 02:20 AM] jl777c#5810
at validation time you are constrained in what you can do


[28-Oct-18 02:20 AM] jl777c#5810
very easy to get into a deadlock with all the semaphores being locked at higher levels


[28-Oct-18 02:21 AM] jl777c#5810
the threshold should be a dynamic one. unless it is just set to the max possible bets per block


[28-Oct-18 02:21 AM] jl777c#5810
if it is set to 100, and there are 200 bets wanting to be made each block, half of them will fail


[28-Oct-18 02:22 AM] jl777c#5810
so block.tx.size() + 100 would be a good blocknotify threshold


[28-Oct-18 02:22 AM] Deleted User#0000

[28-Oct-18 04:11 AM] B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Kmdice seems to be a good tool to test the performance and illustrate the scalibity of Komodo blokchain. I wonder if it works as a zero-sum game or not. As far as I understand, people bet against the fund having half of total supply as premined coins. When betting, do people lose their bet into that fund? If so, it will be like a lottery game which means a zero-sum game. Or is it one side where people do not lose their bet. In that case it would be somehow draining all the funds in premined address in some period of time. Which one is the case?


[28-Oct-18 04:14 AM] Deleted User#0000

[28-Oct-18 04:24 AM] jl777c#5810
dice is a zero sum game against the dealer/house


[28-Oct-18 04:24 AM] jl777c#5810
lost bets go into the fund


[28-Oct-18 04:24 AM] jl777c#5810
wins come out of the fund


[28-Oct-18 04:24 AM] jl777c#5810
the realtime nature of bet resolution makes it quite addictive

[29-Oct-18 03:12 AM] jl777c#5810
on validating a block, all the tx in the block are put in to the mempool to remove any order dependent validation requirements


[29-Oct-18 03:12 AM] jl777c#5810
but if in the mempool there are already some conflicting tx, it wouldnt be able to put some that are in the block into the mempool!


[29-Oct-18 03:12 AM] Deleted User#0000
this makes sense as its random txs and never the same ones.. they just disappear


[29-Oct-18 03:12 AM] Deleted User#0000
requiring resync to get them back


[29-Oct-18 03:13 AM] jl777c#5810
so we need to remove from the mempool any conflicting tx to the one coming from the block


[29-Oct-18 03:13 AM] jl777c#5810
no wonder it is hard to fix

[29-Oct-18 03:13 AM] jl777c#5810

[29-Oct-18 03:14 AM] jl777c#5810
i mean confirmed


[29-Oct-18 03:14 AM] Deleted User#0000
thats what happens yes


[29-Oct-18 03:14 AM] jl777c#5810
and then it ends up with tx in the mempool that are now orphaned, but the local node wont see that as it rejects the block that contradicts it


[29-Oct-18 03:14 AM] jl777c#5810
aha!


[29-Oct-18 03:15 AM] jl777c#5810
so now we understand the causal factor for all the strange behavior!!


[29-Oct-18 03:15 AM] jl777c#5810
in main.cpp there is a loop adding to the mempool in block validation


[29-Oct-18 03:15 AM] jl777c#5810
it actually does it iteratively as the tx in the block can be in any order


[29-Oct-18 03:16 AM] jl777c#5810
ok, a quick test idea!


[29-Oct-18 03:16 AM] jl777c#5810
before that loop, just clear the local mempool entirely


[29-Oct-18 03:16 AM] jl777c#5810
then there cant be anything conflicting in the mempool, the block confirms, node will not go on a fork or get stuck


[29-Oct-18 03:17 AM] Deleted User#0000

For local wallet I did same algo, but it checks if you have over 200 utxo in your wallet before applying random filter... ended up removing this though as I expect it to cause issues for peopel who dont understand utxo's ...

[30-Oct-18 05:49 AM] jl777c#5810

[30-Oct-18 05:50 AM] jl777c#5810

[30-Oct-18 06:05 AM] Deleted User#0000

[30-Oct-18 06:06 AM] jl777c#5810
additionally, making it have more of an internal state machine control flow, with different queues for different states would get 10x or more capacity


[30-Oct-18 06:06 AM] jl777c#5810
right now one node is queuing all dicebets to process


[30-Oct-18 06:06 AM] jl777c#5810
then in the background processes them serially


[30-Oct-18 06:07 AM] jl777c#5810
i guess that can just be made into multiple threads to make things go in parallel as long as the proper locks are done


[30-Oct-18 06:07 AM] jl777c#5810
multithreaded dapp code is a bit tricky though


[30-Oct-18 06:07 AM] jl777c#5810
there really isnt that much processing, most of it is waiting for it to appear in the mempool


[30-Oct-18 06:08 AM] jl777c#5810
so I would suggest breaking down the dealer node dicebet processing into as many different steps as possible


[30-Oct-18 06:08 AM] jl777c#5810
making a queue of requests for each step


[30-Oct-18 06:08 AM] jl777c#5810
launching a thread to handle each queue

[30-Oct-18 06:12 AM] jl777c#5810
do you have enough to implement the multiple queues approach?


[30-Oct-18 06:12 AM] jl777c#5810
yes it is a bit beyond what you have done so far, but i think within reach


[30-Oct-18 06:12 AM] jl777c#5810
the idea is to not have any sleeps

{Reactions}
üòÇ trollface (2) 

[30-Oct-18 06:13 AM] jl777c#5810
so it is 100% of the time processing a new bet


[30-Oct-18 06:13 AM] jl777c#5810
from what I remember the time from when it is broadcast to when it appears in the mempool was a bit slow and I had to add a sleep


[30-Oct-18 06:14 AM] jl777c#5810
what you do instead of putting a sleep, is to put it into another queue


[30-Oct-18 06:14 AM] jl777c#5810
then the first loop is done!


[30-Oct-18 06:14 AM] jl777c#5810
so it can then keep up with a lot of dicebet coming in


[30-Oct-18 06:15 AM] jl777c#5810
then there is another thread that processes the other queue, what it does it iterate through the list and sees if it is done, if it is, it removes the entry and completes the processing


[30-Oct-18 06:15 AM] jl777c#5810
probably a 10 millisecond sleep at the end of the queue before starting again to prevent eating up 100% of a core just looping over and over


[30-Oct-18 06:15 AM] jl777c#5810
i think the above will increase throughput immensely as it removes the sleep 1 entirely


[30-Oct-18 06:16 AM] jl777c#5810
so if 10 tx can be processed in a second it is 10x capacity increase


[30-Oct-18 06:16 AM] jl777c#5810
but 100+ can be done in a second


[30-Oct-18 06:16 AM] jl777c#5810
ask if you have any questions about the design


[30-Oct-18 06:16 AM] jl777c#5810
this is a standard way to speed things up. whenever there is a need for a sleep, put it in a queue


[30-Oct-18 06:17 AM] jl777c#5810
then process that queue in parallel. if that processing also needs a sleep, you make another queue, etc


[30-Oct-18 06:18 AM] Deleted User#0000
Ok sounds good,


[30-Oct-18 06:25 AM] siu#3920
remember to not have any sleeps :trollface:

[30-Oct-18 02:06 PM] Mylo#8306
what is the process for creating a 50% premine into the dice contract?


[30-Oct-18 02:08 PM] SHossain#0007
`./komodod -ac_name=KMDICE -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=144.76.217.232 &`
the `-ac_supply=10500000` is the premined fund. you need to create fund the dice contract using that fund

{Reactions}
üëÄ üêî

all I know for sure is that following

[04-Nov-18 11:24 AM] jorian#4555

[04-Nov-18 11:28 AM] Alright#0419
```
bet:
 vin.0: entropy txid from house (must validate vin0 of 'E')
 vins.1+: normal inputs
 vout.0: CC vout for locked entropy
 vout.1: CC vout for locked bet
 vout.2: tag for bettor's address (txfee + odds)
 vout.3: change
 vout.n-1: opreturn 'B' sbits fundingtxid entropy
```

[05-Nov-18 05:25 PM] Mylo#8306
it's an introduction crypto condition.   shows a challenge-response mechanism, PNRG by getting part from dealer part from player.   2nd story here https://komodoplatform.com/tech-tuesday-update-8/  @Bryan_Beus

{Embed}
https://komodoplatform.com/tech-tuesday-update-8

[05-Nov-18 05:29 PM] Bryan_Beus#6442

[05-Nov-18 05:36 PM] Bryan_Beus#6442

[05-Nov-18 05:38 PM] Decker#3767
My personal point of view - is just an example of features provided by CC ... it can be used with other CC on one chain, but i can't imagine real cases of usage of dice cc jointly with other CC.

{Reactions}
üëç 

[05-Nov-18 05:43 PM] Mylo#8306
It follows the informal spec of what it is set out to do.

For the moment it demonstrates things that can be done that are different to the other CCs.   Same answer can be applied to each CC.  They can be standalone solutions to that given problem.  oracles, gateways etc.

If there's a use case in the future for locking coins from other chains, sure gateway could be done - but as a reference contract, diceCC does what it does.

The entropy tx is another feature of diceCC i should have mentioned earlier.


[05-Nov-18 05:49 PM] Bryan_Beus#6442
Seems like the entropy aspect of dice is what we should be putting in the docs?


[05-Nov-18 05:49 PM] Bryan_Beus#6442

"result"        (string)  whether the diceaddress method was successful
"DiceCCaddress" (string)   
"Dicemarker"    (string) 
"CCaddress"     (string)
"myCCaddress"   (string)
"myaddress"     (string)
```

[05-Nov-18 06:27 PM] Mylo#8306
result  is like all other rpc, e.g. "success" or "error"

the rest are smart contract addresses.
a cpl of those addresses are explained here https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/Mastering_CryptoConditions/blob/master/Chapter%2002%20-%20CC%20contract%20basics#L37
privkey for diceCC is here https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/FSM/src/cc/CCcustom.cpp#L98

I'd have to play it to make reason of the relationship between addresses, the player, the dealer the game.  I'm not even a KMDice noob, but i hope to change that soon

[05-Nov-18 09:49 PM] gcharang#6833
@Bryan_Beus 
afaik:
```
"result"        (string)  whether the diceaddress method was successful
```
```
"DiceCCaddress" (string)  is the address that corresponds to the dice priv key in the source code, but it has the dice eval code modifying it 
```
```
"Dicemarker"    (string)  is the normal address generated from the dice priv key that is in the source code
```
```
"CCaddress"     (string) seems to be same as myCCaddress for dice. But might be different for other contracts
```
```
"myCCaddress"   (string) CC address of the user (from the pubkey that was used to start the daemon which was modified by dice eval code)
```
```
"myaddress"     (string) normal address of the user (from the pubkey that was used to start the daemon)
```
@jl777c  please correct any mistakes from the above  explanations


[05-Nov-18 11:28 PM] jl777c#5810
seems fine


[05-Nov-18 11:30 PM] jl777c#5810
it would be possible to combine dice CC outcomes into another CC, the other CC would just have to have a dice tx proof as input, so it could be a more complex game that has some specific random chance events that are needed. but the purpose of dice CC is more to show what is possible, using a similar method a large class of other CC can be created, ie. challenge/response, deterministically provably random, realtime gameplay

[06-Nov-18 09:01 AM] Decker#3767
https://github.com/z-classic/node-stratum-pool/issues/39#issuecomment-436327781 - fix for pools updated. Without updated fix mining of block like this http://kmdice.explorer.dexstats.info/block/000000f19c5d5f3b0c69d787a8d669fd5256913b684fac37c91d81bc8c39494c was impossible. I saw that 183 tx stucks in mempool for a long time, when i saw this - i started my own pool and it was unable to send block with 183 txes to daemon with error "unable to decode". Now it's fixed, after applying this fix your pool software will be able to mine any txes length block.

{Embed}
https://github.com/z-classic/node-stratum-pool/issues/39
Wrong VARINT encoding for Transaction Count field in Blocktemplate...
We have wrong varint encoding here https://github.com/z-classic/node-stratum-pool/blob/master/lib/blockTemplate.js#L91 for transaction count in block. Let's see results of default implementatio...

[06-Nov-18 05:16 PM] jl777c#5810
each dicebet has a chance of being rejected, even if it looked good at the time the tx was created


[06-Nov-18 05:16 PM] jl777c#5810
this is because the utxo are constantly being used


[06-Nov-18 05:17 PM] jl777c#5810
so if your sendrawtransaction doesnt work, it means it was rejected. this is a normal possibility


[06-Nov-18 05:17 PM] jl777c#5810
even if it gets into the mempool locally, the miners mempool is what matters, so it can get orphaned after being in the mempool


[06-Nov-18 05:18 PM] jl777c#5810
further, even if it got into the mempool and was confirmed, normal reorgs could happen and orphan an already confirmed bet!


[06-Nov-18 05:18 PM] jl777c#5810
the blockchain is complex

[07-Nov-18 08:03 AM] jl777c#5810
ok, current version is a release candidate:
1. dealer node is much more efficient
2. entropy tx is automatically created to maintain 5000 utxo
3. large bets are handled
4. various edge case errors fixed
5. detection of the same entropy being used and in that case the dicebet is refunded. even in a nonattack scenario this can happen. a dicestatus where you win what you bet indicates it was refunded
6. smarter handling of auto-broadcasting

assuming it can handle multiple node stress test without getting confused and doesnt allow 51% secret reveal attacks, it just might be ready for production use. I estimate chance of KMDICE being able to be salvaged at 70%. The questions are if it has good enough performance using a single dealer node and if the dealer node can synce from scratch. I will do that now as things seem to be quiet, will post when it is back to the current mainchain. so get ready for stress test, but dont start it till I post it is ready

[08-Nov-18 02:17 PM] jl777c#5810
bool SignTx(CMutableTransaction &mtx,int32_t vini,int64_t utxovalue,const CScript scriptPubKey)


[08-Nov-18 02:18 PM] TonyL#3577
Built on my side without issues


[08-Nov-18 02:19 PM] ComputerGenie#7004
```bool SignTx(CMutableTransaction &mtx,int32_t vini,int64_t utxovalue,const CScript scriptPubKey)
{
#ifdef ENABLE_WALLET
    CTransaction txNewConst(mtx); SignatureData sigdata; const CKeyStore& keystore = *pwalletMain;
    auto consensusBranchId = CurrentEpochBranchId(chainActive.Height() + 1, Params().GetConsensus());
    if ( ProduceSignature(TransactionSignatureCreator(&keystore,&txNewConst,vini,utxovalue,SIGHASH_ALL),scriptPubKey,sigdata,consensusBranchId) != 0 )
    {
        UpdateTransaction(mtx,vini,sigdata);
        return(true);
    } else fprintf(stderr,"signing error for SignTx vini.%d %.8f\n",vini,(double)utxovalue/COIN);
#else
    return(false);
#endif
}```

[08-Nov-18 02:21 PM] jl777c#5810
bool SignTx(CMutableTransaction &mtx,int32_t vini,int64_t utxovalue,const CScript scriptPubKey)
{
#ifdef ENABLE_WALLET
    CTransaction txNewConst(mtx); SignatureData sigdata; const CKeyStore& keystore = *pwalletMain;
    auto consensusBranchId = CurrentEpochBranchId(chainActive.Height() + 1, Params().GetConsensus());
    if ( ProduceSignature(TransactionSignatureCreator(&keystore,&txNewConst,vini,utxovalue,SIGHASH_ALL),scriptPubKey,sigdata,consensusBranchId) != 0 )
    {
        UpdateTransaction(mtx,vini,sigdata);
        return(true);
    } else fprintf(stderr,"signing error for SignTx vini.%d %.8f\n",vini,(double)utxovalue/COIN);
#endif
    return(false);
}

[08-Nov-18 02:54 PM] ComputerGenie#7004
```check=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=$AssetChain dicestatus $gamename $fundingtxid $sendbet | jq -r '.')
    result=$(jq -r ".status" <<<"${check}")
    if [[ "$result" == "bet still pending" ]] ; then
        ((PendingTimes += 1))```

[08-Nov-18 03:32 PM] Deleted User#0000
```#!/bin/bash

address=RRoC3gu4cTgPsVSbYg1vFGbtcum8X7PPz9 # Fnode
#address=RU3yYGAz1xVjkLbeEdxKq5WpQNDdkYd83V # cc
#address=RGySymLoUMN4LEFFwCFSxo14GSJFvFjH8p # test node at home

JSON='"{\"'
JSON2='\":0.00001,\"'

for i in `seq 1 500`; do
     JSON+=$address
     JSON+=$JSON2
done
JSON="${JSON%???}}\""
echo $JSON```
You will nned this to build a sendmany to make enough utxo to make the random sleection work.

[10-Nov-18 03:22 AM] TonyL#3577
```
#!/bin/bash
BETS=0
while [ $BETS -lt 500 ]; do
    hash=$(komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicebet KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f 0.001 1500 | jq -r .hex)
    txid=$(komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE sendrawtransaction $hash >> bets_odds_1500.txt)
    let BETS=BETS+1
done
```

[10-Nov-18 07:28 AM] jl777c#5810
in some places, bitcoin requires optimal varint encoding


[10-Nov-18 07:28 AM] jl777c#5810
so if you use 2 bytes for 129 to 255, it could be rejecting it, even though it is valid varint, it isnt optimal


[10-Nov-18 07:29 AM] jl777c#5810
the code fix for the pools that i saw used non-optimal varint


[10-Nov-18 07:29 AM] Decker#3767
https://github.com/z-classic/node-stratum-pool/issues/39#issuecomment-436327781 - that's why i changed patch.

{Embed}
https://github.com/z-classic/node-stratum-pool/issues/39
Wrong VARINT encoding for Transaction Count field in Blocktemplate...
We have wrong varint encoding here https://github.com/z-classic/node-stratum-pool/blob/master/lib/blockTemplate.js#L91 for transaction count in block. Let's see results of default implementatio...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/8Zm3nuko0hJQYegJyi9jjc0I2bbSAnM13Ef4WCiLC1M/%3Fs%3D400%26v%3D4/https/avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/22120003


[10-Nov-18 07:29 AM] jl777c#5810
about to test some fixes that might break the chain.. trying to properly fix the entropy reused detection


[10-Nov-18 07:30 AM] Decker#3767
with this:
```        /* https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Protocol_documentation#Variable_length_integer */
        if (this.txCount < 0xfd){
            var varInt = new Buffer(txCount, 'hex');
        }
        else if (this.txCount <= 0xffff){
            var varInt = new Buffer.concat([Buffer('FD', 'hex'), util.reverseBuffer(new Buffer(txCount, 'hex'))]);
        }```
i mined 180 tx in block without any issues ... and it's not rejected ...

        /* https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Protocol_documentation#Variable_length_integer */
        if (this.txCount < 0xfd){
            var varInt = new Buffer(txCount, 'hex');
        }
        else if (this.txCount <= 0xffff){

[10-Nov-18 09:31 AM] 0x03#8822
üòÑ


[10-Nov-18 09:36 AM] jl777c#5810
good news! The problem I had was that I made 100 payment tx to create a bunch of vouts for the parallel dicefinish


[10-Nov-18 09:37 AM] jl777c#5810
this made me find the bug that I wrongly assumed the vout for the entropy txid would always be 0, off by one in the vout/vin dereferencing

{Reactions}
üëçüèΩ 

[10-Nov-18 09:37 AM] jl777c#5810
so to fix it, I needed to include the vout into the entropy calculation


[10-Nov-18 09:37 AM] jl777c#5810
but that would be a hardforking change and I didnt want to do it two days in a row


[10-Nov-18 09:38 AM] 0x03#8822
one hardfork a day keeps the doctor away *scnr*

{Reactions}
üòÇ 

[10-Nov-18 09:38 AM] 0x03#8822
i'll show myself out :trollface:


[10-Nov-18 09:38 AM] jl777c#5810
but, after analysing the code, I realized that only the dealer node actually calculates the entropy for the dealer entropy and that the players are posting their entropy in the opreturn, so they can change how they calculate it at anytime


[10-Nov-18 09:39 AM] jl777c#5810
but there are 7000+ entropy tx using the old broken way to calculate the entropy


[10-Nov-18 09:39 AM] jl777c#5810
luckily the validation uses the proof of hash of entropy, ie. the entropy used in the dicefinish tx


[10-Nov-18 09:39 AM] jl777c#5810
and the entropy tx includes the hash of entropy


[10-Nov-18 09:40 AM] jl777c#5810
so, the dealer side can compare the entropy using the old way and if the hash of entropy matches, to use that. if not to use the new bug fixed method!

{Reactions}
shexy 

[10-Nov-18 09:40 AM] jl777c#5810
and i am seeing this work now that we had a bunch of bets go by


[10-Nov-18 09:40 AM] jl777c#5810
so after a while the entropy collision will go away and the 51% secret reveal attack will be properly detected


[10-Nov-18 09:41 AM] jl777c#5810
all this was a pretty good test of the 51% attack detection


[10-Nov-18 09:41 AM] jl777c#5810
tl:dr spam the bets as much as possible and try to break the chain


[10-Nov-18 09:42 AM] jl777c#5810
still have the dealer node optimization to make it go faster, but that wont affect any consensus, or actually any behavior as it would be an inplace change. which means we are down to just a few things left before we can consider KMDICE completed at the core level


[10-Nov-18 09:43 AM] siu#3920

[10-Nov-18 01:44 PM] jl777c#5810
mtx.vin.push_back(CTxIn(entropytxid,0,CScript()));
        if ( AddNormalinputs(mtx,mypk,bet+2*txfee+odds,60) > 0 )
        {
            hentropy = DiceHashEntropy(entropy,mtx.vin[0].prevout.hash,mtx.vin[0].prevout.n,1);
            mtx.vout.push_back(MakeCC1vout(cp->evalcode,entropyval,dicepk));
            mtx.vout.push_back(MakeCC1vout(cp->evalcode,bet,dicepk));
            mtx.vout.push_back(CTxOut(txfee+odds,CScript() << ParseHex(HexStr(mypk)) << OP_CHECKSIG));
            return(FinalizeCCTx(0,cp,mtx,mypk,txfee,EncodeDiceOpRet('B',sbits,fundingtxid,entropy,zeroid)));
        }


[10-Nov-18 01:45 PM] jl777c#5810
you just need to use a different entropytxid/v0 for each one


[10-Nov-18 01:45 PM] jl777c#5810
if you make it broadcast after each one is created, then AddNormalinputs will check the mempool


[10-Nov-18 01:46 PM] jl777c#5810
now if you made the bet a fixed size for the blast and premake the correct sized utxo, then you can change the AddNormalInputs() call to just be:
mtx.vin.push_back(CTxIn(txids[i],vins[i],CScript()));


[10-Nov-18 01:47 PM] jl777c#5810
since you are allocating from the same array in an incrementing fashion, you wont conflict with any of your own dicebets


[10-Nov-18 01:47 PM] jl777c#5810
really, that is all that is needed


[10-Nov-18 01:48 PM] jl777c#5810
just hinge off of funcid.E they are valid entropy utxo, so you can scan for them


[10-Nov-18 01:48 PM] jl777c#5810
in any case, being able to construct a valid CC tx is very useful as we really need to test making illegal tx and make sure the validation catches them properly

[10-Nov-18 03:46 PM] Mylo#8306
@Tylor zkFS dependencies are there under "Get Komodo binaries" heading following that link.

And yes, at the current state of development FSM branch is being bug fixed.
```
git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo
cd komodo
git checkout FSM
./zcutil/build.sh -j4    <---if you have 4 threads
```
Use the command in the channel description here in discord whilst bug fixing is happening, maybe the node in the docs is out of date.   This will be updated once bugs are fixed for stress testing it.
`./komodod -ac_name=KMDICE -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=5.9.102.210 &`

[10-Nov-18 03:48 PM] Mylo#8306
and you don't have to build master then switch, you can switch immediately after cloning.   master is just another branch, FSM is just another branch.   It is only a naming convention that `master` is used for the main branch.
no probs

[11-Nov-18 01:26 AM] CrisF#3405
@Tylor zkFS  This worked for me
```copy compilied binaries from different branch into different directory and issue calls from there

Example: After compiling komodo using jl777 branch, use:

-------------------------------
cd ~
mkdir jl777
cp ~/komodo/src/komodod ~/jl777/komodod
cp ~/komodo/src/komodo-cli ~/jl777/komodo-cli
cd jl777
./komodod ........
-------------------------------

After compiling komodo using dev branch, use:

-------------------------------
cd ~
mkdir dev
cp ~/komodo/src/komodod ~/dev/komodod
cp ~/komodo/src/komodo-cli ~/dev/komodo-cli
cd dev
./komodod ........
-------------------------------```

[11-Nov-18 05:14 AM] jl777c#5810
updated dealer node with hashtables instead of linear search. now the CPU usage is 1% to 2% with about a 3 second spike to 25% when a new block comes in. of course under heavy load, I expect it will go up in usage. code is now feature complete, including 51% secret reveal protection.
all that is left is to find and fix load caused bugs for the dealer node


[11-Nov-18 05:16 AM] jl777c#5810
even with dealer node offline for a while, as soon as it gets back in sync, it catches up with all the pending bets within a block


[11-Nov-18 05:16 AM] jl777c#5810
very pleased with stability and performance now

[11-Nov-18 07:22 AM] Alright#0419
Can someone explain the 51% refund thing to me please?


[11-Nov-18 07:22 AM] jl777c#5810
so if it deadlocks you can ctrl-C and see where it was stuck


[11-Nov-18 07:22 AM] jl777c#5810
if same entropy tx is used, it allows to cheat


[11-Nov-18 07:22 AM] Alright#0419
if dicefinish tx is reorged it defaults to refund?


[11-Nov-18 07:22 AM] jl777c#5810
so if it is detected, it is refunded


[11-Nov-18 07:22 AM] jl777c#5810
entropy is a single reveal basis


[11-Nov-18 07:22 AM] jl777c#5810
once you see the entropy, you can just calculate a winning player entropy at whatever odds


[11-Nov-18 07:23 AM] jl777c#5810
so refund is the only sane thing to do, as it is possible that without any evil intent you choose the same entropy tx that was already selected by somebody else


[11-Nov-18 07:23 AM] jl777c#5810
of course you can also do it with evil intent, but only the first one that is dicefinished is valid, the rest are refunded


[11-Nov-18 07:24 AM] jl777c#5810
at least that is what it is supposed to do


[11-Nov-18 07:24 AM] Alright#0419
and if that valid one is reorged no other bets can use that entropy?


[11-Nov-18 07:24 AM] Alright#0419
they just refund?


[11-Nov-18 07:25 AM] jl777c#5810
yes

it is really quite clever way to avoid this attack

I have been thinking about a new way to remove old txs, get all txs in the wallet , sort by blockheight and iterate backeards down the list checking for unspents, once you count unspents that equal the balance jjst delete everythig before this last transactio. ```bet=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=$AssetChain dicebet $gamename $fundingtxid $wager $odds | jq -r '.')
bethex=$(jq -r ".hex" <<<"${bet}")
sendbet=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=$AssetChain sendrawtransaction $bethex)```

[15-Nov-18 06:37 AM] jusoaresf#3291
when we win... is it normal to receive more than the what we had bet ?


[15-Nov-18 06:52 AM] jorian#4555
that's how betting normally works


[15-Nov-18 07:00 AM] jusoaresf#3291
tks
so bet * odds is what is in the bet...


[15-Nov-18 07:27 AM] ComputerGenie#7004
on a win:
if you bet 2 at 10 odds, you get 22 `2*10 + 2`
if you bet 2 at 5 odds, you get 12 `2*5 + 2`
you get the payout *plus* your bet back


[15-Nov-18 07:30 AM] jusoaresf#3291
yes... tks. cannot forget the "redeem" of the value we placed on the bet

Hi folks,
I need help understanding how to interpret the command outputs where 2 consecutive equal commands & parameters produce 2 different responses.
First as win then as refund or pending...


[16-Nov-18 05:17 AM] jusoaresf#3291
First example
```
$ ./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicestatus KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f 25372d9f211b6e55b879371f62da530fbdf316c74897026c349bab56a3577e95
{
  "result": "success",
  "status": "win",
  "won": 24
}
```
in the sequence
```
$ ./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicestatus KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f 25372d9f211b6e55b879371f62da530fbdf316c74897026c349bab56a3577e95
{
  "result": "success",
  "status": "win",
  "won": 6
}
```

Another one went like this
```$ ./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicestatus KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f 4e208c87bfd333562bb3ad3ca5967d87038013b43e47334a51b4541133d208d2
{
  "result": "success",
  "status": "win",
  "won": 10.5
}
```
and then
```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicestatus KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f 4e208c87bfd333562bb3ad3ca5967d87038013b43e47334a51b4541133d208d2
{
  "result": "success",
  "status": "bet still pending"
}```

So... we need to refrain to report as a winning? How long?

[01-Dec-18 09:10 AM] siu#3920
```#!/bin/bash 

while true; do
    sleep 2
    echo "KMDICE"

    cd ~/komodo/src
    getinfo=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE getinfo)
    balance=$(echo $getinfo | jq -r '.balance')
    echo 'Wallet balance:' $balance
    entropy=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE diceinfo 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f)
    entropytx=$(echo $entropy | jq -r '.entropytxs')
    echo 'Entropy txs available:' $entropytx
    bet=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicebet KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f  $1 $2)
    bet_hex=$(echo $bet | jq -r '.hex')
    bet_txid=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE sendrawtransaction $bet_hex)
    echo $bet_txid
    echo $bet_txid >> ~/bets.txt
        echo "$bet_txid" > ~/bettxid.txt
    echo "Waiting bet tx to confirm"
    sleep 10
    bet_status=$(komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicestatus KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f $bet_txid)
    betStatus_result=$(echo $bet_status | jq -r '.status')
    betAmount_result=$(echo $bet_status | jq -r '.won')
    if [ "$betAmount_result" != "null" ]; then figlet $betAmount_result
    fi
    echo $betStatus_result
    echo $betStatus_result >> ~/bets.txt
done

```


[01-Dec-18 09:10 AM] siu#3920
you can try this script to get a loop of bets

[01-Dec-18 09:13 AM] siu#3920
@SHossain you can also then use this script to get stats of the resutls: ```#!/bin/bash

loss=$(tr ' ' '\n' < ~/bets.txt | grep loss | wc -l)
win=$(tr ' ' '\n' < ~/bets.txt | grep win | wc -l)
null=$(tr ' ' '\n' < ~/bets.txt | grep null | wc -l)
betstillpending=$(cat ~/bets.txt | grep "bet still pending" | wc -l)
total=$(wc -l < ~/bets.txt)
totalbets=$(echo ''$total' / 2' | bc)

echo 'Wins:' $win
echo 'Losses:' $loss
echo 'Bets still pending:' $betstillpending
echo 'Nulls:' $null
echo 'Total bets': $totalbets
```

[01-Dec-18 03:29 PM] SHossain#0007
```
./betstats

Total bets: 1126

[01-Dec-18 03:29 PM] SHossain#0007
a lot of bets done


[01-Dec-18 03:29 PM] siu#3920
```#!/bin/bash 

while true; do
        sleep 2
        echo "KMDICE"

        cd ~/komodo/src
        getinfo=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE getinfo)
        balance=$(echo $getinfo | jq -r '.balance')
        echo 'Wallet balance:' $balance
        entropy=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE diceinfo 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f)
        entropytx=$(echo $entropy | jq -r '.entropytxs')
        echo 'Entropy txs available:' $entropytx
        bet=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicebet KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f  $1 $2)
        bet_hex=$(echo $bet | jq -r '.hex')
        bet_txid=$(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE sendrawtransaction $bet_hex)
        echo $bet_txid
        echo $bet_txid >> ~/bets.txt
        echo "$bet_txid" > ~/bettxid.txt
        echo "Waiting bet tx to confirm"
        while true; do
                bet_status=$(komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE dicestatus KMDICE 5be49570c56d036abb08b6d084da93a8a86f58fc48db4a1086be95540d752d6f $bet_txid)
                betStatus_result=$(echo $bet_status | jq -r '.status')
                betAmount_result=$(echo $bet_status | jq -r '.won')
                if [[ ! $betStatus_result =~ "bet still pending" ]]; then
                break
                fi
                sleep .5
        done
        if [ "$betAmount_result" != "null" ]; then echo $betAmount_result
        fi
        echo $betStatus_result
        echo $betStatus_result >> ~/bets.txt
done


```

[13-Dec-18 09:32 AM] ComputerGenie#7004
`How can I calculate with my ksol power ?`
literally the same as every other equihash coin...
```HashMultiplier="6"    #1 for sol/s, 3 for ksol/s, 6 for Msol/s
MyHashRate="1" # or whatever your amount is in relation to sol/s, ksol/s, or Msol/s
AmIalreadyHashing=false
if $AmIalreadyHashing; then
    blocksPerDay="$(echo "scale=8; (24*(1/((60/(($MyHashRate*(1^$HashMultiplier))/($NetworkHashRate*(1^$HashMultiplier))))/3600)))" | bc)"
else
    blocksPerDay="$(echo "scale=8; (24*(1/((60/(($MyHashRate*(1^$HashMultiplier))/(($NetworkHashRate+$MyHashRate)*(1^$HashMultiplier))))/3600)))" | bc)"
fi```

{Reactions}
üíØ 

[13-Dec-18 09:38 AM] ComputerGenie#7004
üëÜüèΩ assumes you're on level with network, otherwise you'd need to add a bit more math to separate the powers

üò≤ üöÄ (2) 

[28-Dec-18 08:02 PM] TonyL#3577
@HenryChinaski You have to run a komodo daemon locally for asset chain on which you want to play
For example you can start KMDICE native mode in Agama
Then your config with RPC username, password and port will be in `%AppData%/Komodo/KMDICE/KMDICE.conf`


[28-Dec-18 08:02 PM] TonyL#3577
If you run daemon locally as IP use 127.0.0.1


[28-Dec-18 08:05 PM] TonyL#3577
Connection details will be saved to file after successful connection so you'll not need to input it again. 
Actually daemon can be started anywhere (that's why I left IP field). For example I have one node on Ubuntu VPS and can play on any of my PCs from same "account" (actually wallet) without daemon installation/syncing. But if you run it on remote server - additional RPC whitelisting by IP needed


[28-Dec-18 08:39 PM] HenryChinaski#2919

[28-Dec-18 08:39 PM] HenryChinaski#2919

[28-Dec-18 08:39 PM] HenryChinaski#2919
Thanks for the info


[28-Dec-18 08:39 PM] HenryChinaski#2919

[31-Dec-18 03:03 AM] Alright#0419

[31-Dec-18 10:06 AM] siu#3920
When the diceplan died some months ago due to lack of enough entropy txs, and @jl777c worked on the code to fix it, he was able to claim the 10million KMDICE UTXO that had become the issue all along. So we resubmited the first 5 million in thousands of 1000 KMDICE UTXOS and will be funding it continually up to 8 million.  Then 2 million will be airdropped to KMD holders in the coming months, when we get a official GUI.

Cee-lo
Cee-lo is a gambling game played with three six-sided dice.  There is not one standard set of rules, but there are some constants that hold true to all sets of rules. The name comes from the Chinese S√¨-W≈≠-Li√π (Âõõ‰∫îÂÖ≠), meaning "four-five-six". In America it is also call...


[09-Jan-19 11:01 PM] TonyL#3577
Current Dice CC can't return random value in given diapason, it returns Win or Loss with given probability for Win


[09-Jan-19 11:05 PM] TonyL#3577
Actually I think "Dice" name for this CC quite confusing - since people starting to imagine the usual dice where you getting a random number in range after throw, but this CC provide only result - kinda "GambleCC". Actually a lot of games possible to make but with pseudo RNG on already known result GUI representation part (I've posted example of such implementation in #cc-dice - same way possible to make blackjack and other games) what players might don't like. On current contract only possible to build a game which provides RPC calls of contract (gamble bet with odds)


[09-Jan-19 11:52 PM] Meyse#0952
How do you mean "what players might not like"? If the GUI is good the players won't even notice that the result has been given already and the GUI just is a representation of that.


[10-Jan-19 12:26 AM] TonyL#3577
I mean that player might not like that blockchain returned "won" but he see "5" or "6" instead. If you're playing usual dice game your result is a number from 1 to 6 (each one you can get with probability 1/6) but DiceCC can't return numbers - it can return only won or lose with given probability


[10-Jan-19 12:37 AM] Meyse#0952
Ah right, but I don't think it matters, cause the player won't see the difference anyway. You can present the player a number, even though the blockchain just says "won". The player probably won't even care, or even know about this, as long as it's all fair. 
This can be done with all games, roulette, slot machines, whatever


[10-Jan-19 12:46 AM] TonyL#3577
Let's say you want to make blackjack. There are 52 cards in deck. You need to draw one. 
Probability 1/52 so you placing a bet do diceCC with odds 51 (1:52). You get a result "won" - which card you'll show to player?


[10-Jan-19 12:46 AM] TonyL#3577
Or you want to roll dice: dice have 6 numbers. You placing a bet with odds 1:6 and get result "loss"


[10-Jan-19 12:46 AM] TonyL#3577
Which number you will show to player?


[10-Jan-19 12:46 AM] Meyse#0952
Im not great with the rules of gambling games. But roulette should be easy


[10-Jan-19 12:47 AM] Meyse#0952
It doesn't matter which number you show, as long as it's the one that the player didn't bet on, your dice example


[10-Jan-19 12:50 AM] Meyse#0952
For me it's easy, for the user it doesn't matter what you show exactly. If the blockchain says "loss", you just let the GUI pick a random number that's not the winner


[10-Jan-19 12:54 AM] TonyL#3577
Best implementation of roulette which I can imagine on it will be very boring - player will be supposed to bet on one result only (number, colour,  dozen or something else) and no multiplayer is possible


[10-Jan-19 12:54 AM] Meyse#0952
I thought about the logic, you can do multiple bets


[10-Jan-19 12:54 AM] TonyL#3577
Since if you put multiply bets which have only won or loss results it's possible that conflicting outcomes will happen


[10-Jan-19 12:55 AM] Meyse#0952
No, conflicting outcomes won't be possible, you just let the GUI pick the number the ball will roll into, based on what the blockchain says how the bets went


[10-Jan-19 12:57 AM] TonyL#3577
I place bet 1 coin on number 5 and place bet 100 coins on number 6 - both numbers have same probability to come 1/38. You placing bet to CC 1:38 and getting result "won"


[10-Jan-19 12:59 AM] Meyse#0952
Oh wow didn't think about that lol, then you can only do 1 unique number maybe. Roulette has many options


[10-Jan-19 12:59 AM] TonyL#3577
And on some point diceCC RNG sense missing at all and you can use "traditional" RNG which you want to put into GUI and use blockchain only for payments


[10-Jan-19 01:00 AM] TonyL#3577
If you playing roulette all you want on spin is random number from 1 to 38, not won or lose - thats why I think for other games other CC needed


[10-Jan-19 01:01 AM] Meyse#0952
You can do red,black,even,uneven,and other number things


[10-Jan-19 01:02 AM] TonyL#3577
Yeah - such things are possible - where no need exact thing like a number 5 or Jack of spades card to evaluate other bets/things.
Btw odds 1:2 not working correct atm and disabled üòÉ

[25-Jan-19 07:02 AM] Mick de Graaf#8098
Hi hi. Quick question: how are the random numbers generated for the betting results?


[25-Jan-19 07:03 AM] jl777c#5810
entropy utxo are created (with hash of entropy)


[25-Jan-19 07:03 AM] jl777c#5810
player selects a random one and attaches his entropy


[25-Jan-19 07:03 AM] jl777c#5810
both are combined to create the two values (entropy revealed)


[25-Jan-19 07:04 AM] Mick de Graaf#8098
Aha nice! thanks for the quick answer


[25-Jan-19 07:05 AM] jl777c#5810
so provably fair, immediately revealed, jointly calculated


[25-Jan-19 07:16 AM] Mick de Graaf#8098
Another question hehe. What if I place a bet  await the result and if I lose 51% attack the network to revert the tx before it the blockhash is submitted to the komodo chain? Would my loss be reverted?


[25-Jan-19 07:25 AM] jl777c#5810
if a 51% attack is detected, then it is canceled


[25-Jan-19 07:25 AM] jl777c#5810
but the first bet would stand


[25-Jan-19 07:26 AM] jl777c#5810
it is not about the tx confirming . or not, but the usage of the entropy tx


[25-Jan-19 07:37 AM] Mick de Graaf#8098
Ok thanks. Sounds interesting. Will read up on it

[28-Feb-19 08:15 AM] 0x03#8822
**Attention miners! Should you currently be mining on kmdice.komodopool.xyz (or have kmdice.komodopool.xyz set as one of your backup pools) - this one is for you!**
Effective now, the main pool host has been migrated to `kmdice.pool-mining.xyz`. The port number for the high diff/NH/MRR port has been changed from 18888 to 8889. Please adapt your miner configs accordingly and reconnect as soon as possible!
Additionally, the pool is now reachable within TOR directly: http://fkusu6b4kuadebew.onion (if you're really brave you can mine to the onion host as well, it works, but it's not recommended)
The old infrastructure will stay online for about a week to not interfere with anybodys potentially open NH/MRR orders. Thank you!
BTW and the new pool website is https://kmdice.pool-mining.xyz

[03-Mar-19 11:01 PM] TonyL#3577
If someone can describe model by which it's possible to make blackjack game logic on current DiceCC - I can  connect some simple GUI like this: https://github.com/momo-ozawa/blackjack-gui. It shouldn't take much time.

I don't see any ways how it's possible to make blackjack on DiceCC RPC calls - maybe somebody else see


[03-Mar-19 11:07 PM] ComputerGenie#7004
because it's 2 numbers and the 2nd is higher or lower than the 1st, you can't
especially since the 1st is static based on odds


[03-Mar-19 11:07 PM] TonyL#3577
I see one way of cards drawing but it need very reliable and fast response from DiceCC (now result may be void and changes on next call what is not suitiable):
Full deck
1) Making dicebet with some not significant sum like a 0.0001 on odds 52
If first bet won you draw 2 of hearts, if second you draw 3 of hearts... if only 52th - it's ace of spades

on  next draw you do same but up to 51 and keep in memory that you have one card less now


[03-Mar-19 11:07 PM] TonyL#3577
And so on


[03-Mar-19 11:08 PM] TonyL#3577
Since its' without edge these "service RNG calls" will give 50/50 result


[03-Mar-19 11:09 PM] TonyL#3577
But it burns txfee on each card draw. Hope oneday someone will make a new VegasCC contract which will allow to create games (CC should combine adjustable RNG which returns random things from diapason/list + ability to create games and accept buyins  / make payout)


[03-Mar-19 11:18 PM] TonyL#3577
I think in theory it's possible to make "gambling-complete" CC on which will be possible to implement any game based on odds and payouts


[03-Mar-19 11:19 PM] ComputerGenie#7004
I agree, it could be done with CC; I just don't see a way to do BJ with DiceCC


[03-Mar-19 11:21 PM] TonyL#3577
Yup, I think the same. Just wanted to explain for those who are waiting for blackjack or something else like this üòÉ


[03-Mar-19 11:26 PM] TonyL#3577
DiceCC just very confusing naming for current contract functionality imo. People imagine usual dice - usual dice return you a number in range of dice edges. Current contract saying did you win or lose, it's something like a WinLoseCC


[03-Mar-19 11:29 PM] TonyL#3577
You even can't make usual dice (craps) casino game on DiceCC because you need to know exact number


[04-Mar-19 12:00 AM] jl777c#5810
there is a 256 bit random number between house and player


[04-Mar-19 12:00 AM] jl777c#5810
if you can generate the gameplay from the 256bits,then you can do it


[04-Mar-19 12:01 AM] TonyL#3577
Can I get this number from RPC?


[04-Mar-19 12:02 AM] jl777c#5810
i thought I made an RPC that displays the RNG


[04-Mar-19 12:02 AM] jl777c#5810
maybe I didnt


[04-Mar-19 12:02 AM] jl777c#5810
but its there in the code


[04-Mar-19 03:25 AM] Meyse#0952
if we can get it to generate a number between a certain range that would be amazing, we can add many more games to our dapp


[04-Mar-19 03:26 AM] jl777c#5810
it is generating a 256 bit hash, which you can extract many numbers from


[04-Mar-19 03:26 AM] jl777c#5810
especially if you make a hashchain out of it


[04-Mar-19 03:34 AM] Meyse#0952
a rpc call would be heaven that prints this number out


[04-Mar-19 03:36 AM] jl777c#5810
yes, ok, after the dicebet is responded to, but the current code will process it as a normal dicebet


[04-Mar-19 03:40 AM] jl777c#5810
the issue is that each games rules needs to be put into the consensus to enforce payouts for a specific game


[04-Mar-19 03:45 AM] jl777c#5810
so for each supported game, i would need to know the exact gamerules and then can make an rpc call that is the equivalent for dicebet for that game

So to shuffle a deck of cards, allocate a hash to each card in array of cards[52] then sort alphanumerical from the hashchain, using 256bit number as the seed?


[04-Mar-19 06:03 AM] Mylo#8306
Ace spade = cards[0] which is hash(256bitRNG)
2 spade = cards[1] = hash(cards[0])
....
sort.

[11-Apr-19 08:26 PM] Alright#0419
@dogracer dealer posts a hash of entropy in an "entropy tx", bettor selects an "entropy tx" to bet against, bets against it, dealer must then reveal this entropy within the "timeout window" or the bet defaults to win

Hi here :).
Barterlly is now open on BETA mode, and will provide tools for users and CoinOwners to perform OTC trades in a safe way.
Any KMD assetchain dPowed will be listed, and supported, for free.
Other coins not already listed can submit a listing application at : https://barterlly.typeform.com/to/iqpS1H
During the BETA, Barterlly won't charge any fee other than the transaction ones. after the release we will charge 1% on top of every transaction.
Our goal is to provide premium tools for coins listed on the platform. (Discord swapbot, twitter integration, public orders, wallet integration, API, custom templating, and many more).
Feel free to join us on our Discord.
https://discord.gg/RHc95zw
The app link is located at : https://app.barterlly.io
We are open to suggestions, and partnerships.

See you soon !

Barterlly's team

[27-May-19 03:40 AM] LeX00#3137
Hi Im new to kmdice, Im abit confuse so can anyone kind to explain whats the different between Kmdice and chips? Do both need to work in parallel?


[27-May-19 03:40 AM] jl777c#5810
they are totally different


[27-May-19 03:44 AM] LeX00#3137
From my understanding, chips are for card games like poker. What about kmdice?


[27-May-19 03:48 AM] gcharang#6833
dice is just betting on a provably random number and automatic payout of the bet - all in a decentralised way
it is a proof of concept on which many other games where a "provably random number" is needed and no one need to trust anyone else can be built


[27-May-19 03:52 AM] LeX00#3137
Seems cool, does it mean it could be applied on games like roulette, sic bo or slot machines?


[27-May-19 03:52 AM] jl777c#5810
yes

[30-Apr-20 06:10 AM] Oszy#5734

[30-Apr-20 06:10 AM] Oszy#5734
you can run the wallet native from CLI 
`./komodod -ac_name=KMDICE -ac_name=KMDICE -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=144.76.217.232`


[30-Apr-20 06:10 AM] Oszy#5734
if the main node is still up


[30-Apr-20 06:11 AM] Oszy#5734
@siu @jorian might know if there's an active electrum

for later: 
```Download Komodo Ocean

import the private key > access your coins```
